title: Eclipse Attack
summary: An attacker isolates a node's peer connections to bias its view of network state.
details: By controlling inbound and outbound peers around a target node, an attacker can delay block/transaction visibility and influence decisions that depend on timely propagation.
impact: Increased reorg risk perception, degraded node reliability, and easier setup for other attack classes.
mitigations: Use modern Bitcoin Core networking protections and updates.
Monitor peers and chain tip anomalies operationally.

title: Selfish Mining
summary: A miner withholds found blocks to gain strategic revenue advantage over honest miners.
details: Instead of immediately publishing valid blocks, an attacker attempts to privately extend a hidden chain and release it strategically to invalidate honest work.
impact: Potentially worsened decentralization incentives and increased stale/orphan dynamics.
mitigations: Improve block propagation speed and relay infrastructure.
Promote hashrate distribution across independent operators.
Track orphan/stale patterns for suspicious dynamics.

title: Fee Sniping
summary: A miner may attempt a short reorg to capture unusually large recent transaction fees.
details: When fee spikes are extreme, miners can face incentive edge cases where trying to replace the previous tip appears profitable under some assumptions.
impact: Higher short-range reorg pressure during unusual fee events.
mitigations: Deeper confirmation requirements for high-value settlement.
Healthy fee market and hashrate competition.
Operational detection of abnormal reorg frequency.

title: Replace-by-Fee Abuse Pattern
summary: RBF can be abused against zero-confirmation acceptance assumptions in weak merchant flows.
details: An attacker may broadcast a low-fee transaction and later replace it with a higher-fee conflicting transaction under opt-in/full-RBF policy conditions.
impact: Payment reversal risk for recipients relying on unconfirmed acceptance without controls.
mitigations: Avoid zero-conf settlement for sensitive amounts.
Use explicit confirmation policies and mempool monitoring.
Understand local node RBF policy behavior.
